medical_history.chief_complaint: 24-hour history of right lower quadrant abdominal pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began 24 hours prior to presentation, with constant and slowly progressive abdominal pain. There were subjective reports of fevers and chills. The patient denied nausea and vomiting. Last bowel movement was normal the night before. The patient has been passing flatus and bowel movements without problems.
medical_history.past_medical_history: migraines, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, depression, osteoporosis, aneurysm, cholelithiasis, bleeding ulcer, history of small bowel obstruction and distal small bowel wall thickening, diverticulosis
